title: The Mortifying Menopause Moment at My Daughter's Wedding That Changed Everything
excerpt: She was supposed to be giving a toast. Instead, she went completely blank—in front of 200 guests, with her daughter watching. What happened next changed how she understood menopause forever.

config.headline: The Mortifying Menopause Moment That Changed Everything
config.subheading: She practiced that wedding toast 47 times. In front of 200 guests, her mind went completely blank.
config.story: Linda practiced that toast 47 times. She'd written it months in advance, timed it perfectly—two minutes, twelve seconds. Then the DJ handed her the microphone. 200 faces turned toward her. Her daughter looked up with tears already forming. And Linda's mind went completely, catastrophically blank. Not nervous-blank. Gone. Like someone had erased the file. She stood there for eight seconds that felt like eight years. 'I could feel the heat crawling up my neck. Everyone is watching me fall apart.' She mumbled something, made a joke about 'mother of the bride brain,' and sat down. Then locked herself in the bathroom and cried.
